2013-11-07: CTS IV report is out!
OpenITP has announced the availablity of the CTS IV report on their website. Read it! Echelon attended to this event in Berlin on September 29 to October 1, 3013 and had some talks with Tor, Freenet and other folks all over the event.
2013-10-12: Latest announcements around I2P
As this news area is too short and not suitable for all longer announcements, we placed the latest announcements on echelon.i2p. Click on the link and read more about I2P needing help on Transifex, I2P progress on Tahoe-LAFS and the IPv6 bounty for I2P users running I2P on IPv6.
2013-10-02: 0.9.8.1 Released
0.9.8.1 fixes a problem with updating to 0.9.8 on Windows for some people. New installs and non-Windows platforms are not affected, however all platforms will automatically update even if running 0.9.8. See the trac ticket for details and workarounds. Sorry for the problems!
2013-09-30: 0.9.8 Released
0.9.8 includes the long-awaited support for IPv6. It's enabled by default, but of course you need a public IPv6 address to use it. Configuration is on the "network" configuration tab in your console. We also have anonymity improvements including padding of SSU packets and longer router private keys.
If you have a public IPv6 address and you are connecting to another router with a published IPv6 address, it will connect via IPv6. There is a new IPv6 configuration section on /confignet. If IPv6 is causing problems you may disable it there.
For those of you running I2P on faster hardware (generally, 64-bit x86) the router will generate a new identity using longer keys. This will substantially reduce your participating traffic for 48 hours or more, while your router re-integrates into the network. Due to the new keys, the large number of torrent updates, and the recent network growth, we expect substantial disruption to the network for a week or more after the update is released. Please be patient and things should start to improve after a few days.
We are experiencing rapid network growth in the last few weeks, which is causing a bit of a bumpy ride for some, especially on weekends. The network is still performing fairly well, so keep spreading the word. See the release notes for more information on IPv6 and rekeying. Due to recent attacks, logins are disabled on trac and new registrations are disabled on zzz.i2p. Until those services are restored, please report all bugs on IRC freenode or IRC2P #i2p-dev.
